titleStmt.title: Description of A commentary on parts of Maimonides' Mishneh Torah.

availability.licence: This metadata, accompanying images, and the content of London, British Library, Oriental Manuscripts Add MS 27294: A commentary on parts of Maimonides' Mishneh Torah. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: Tidemarks throughout at head and foot, with loss of (carbon) ink in these areas. Repaired and infilled before rebinding.
Folio 1r: Hebrew description of the volume. Folio 2r: contains dates according to six different eras which are only partly legible.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A commentary on parts of Maimonides' Mishneh Torah.

msItem.title: Perush Mishneh Torah [Sefer ha-mada῾] פרוש משנה תורה [ספר מדע]

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 leaves each, signed at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive script of the third quarter of the 15th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Boxed. Spine: ''Alau 'L-Din Al-Muwakkit. Comm. On The Sepher Ham-Madda'. Arab. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,294.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Samuel Schönblum: purchased from him by the British Museum on 14 April 1866: inscribed, folio [ii verso] (fs002v).
